00001 /* windows system-dependent definitions */
00002 /* Any include of <windows.h> should be through this file, which wraps it in various other handling */

00010 /* libstdc++-v3 _really_ dislikes min & max defined as macros. */
00011 /* As of gcc 3.3.1, it defines NOMINMAX itself, so test first, to avoid a redefinition error */
00012 #ifndef NOMINMAX
00013 #define NOMINMAX
00014 #endif

00028 #if LITTLEENDIAN == 0x0001
00029 #  define __LITTLE_ENDIAN 1234
00030 #  ifndef __BYTE_ORDER
00031 #     define __BYTE_ORDER  __LITTLE_ENDIAN
00032 #  endif
00033 #elif BIGENDIAN == 0x0001
00034 #  define __BIG_ENDIAN  1234
00035 #  define __BYTE_ORDER  __BIG_ENDIAN
00036 #endif

00038 #define F_WRLCK   1 /* Write lock */
00039 #define F_UNLCK   2 /* Remove lock */
00040 #define F_GETFL   3 /* Get file status flags */
00041 #define F_SETFL   4 /* Set file status flags */
00042 #define F_DUPFD   0 /* Duplicate file descriptor */
00043 #define F_GETFD   1 /* Get file descriptor flags */
00044 #define F_SETFD   2 /* Set file descriptor flags */
00045 #define F_GETLK   5 /* Get record locking info */
00046 #define F_SETLK   6 /* Set record locking info (non-blocking) */
00047 #define F_SETLKW  7 /* Set record locking info (blocking) */
00048 #define F_SETOWN  8 /* Get owner of socket (receiver of SIGIO) */
00049 #define F_GETOWN  9 /* Set owner of socket (receiver of SIGIO) */

00063 struct flock {
00064   short l_type;
00065   short l_whence;
00066   off_t l_start;
00067   off_t l_len;          /* len == 0 means until end of file */

00073 /* POSIX macros for evaluating exit statuses */
00074 
00075 #ifndef WIFSTOPPED
00076 #  define WIFSTOPPED(w) (((w) & 0xff) == 0x7f)
00077 #endif
00078 #ifndef WIFSIGNALED
00079 #  define WIFSIGNALED(w) (((w) & 0xff) != 0x7f && ((w) & 0xff) != 0)
00080 #endif
00081 #ifndef WIFEXITED
00082 #  define WIFEXITED(w) (((w) & 0xff) == 0)
00083 #endif
00084 #ifndef WSTOPSIG
00085 #  define WSTOPSIG(w) (((w) >> 8) & 0xff)
00086 #endif
00087 #ifndef WTERMSIG
00088 #  define WTERMSIG(w) ((w) & 0x7f)
00089 #endif
00090 #ifndef WEXITSTATUS
00091 #  define WEXITSTATUS(w) (((w) >> 8) & 0xff)
00092 #endif
00093 
00094 /* Protection bits. */
00095 
00096 #ifndef   S_IRUSR
00097 #  define S_IRUSR  0400  /* Read by owner. */
00098 #  define S_IWUSR  0200  /* Write by owner. */
00099 #  define S_IXUSR  0100  /* Execute by owner. */
00100 /* Read, write, and execute by owner. */
00101 #  define S_IRWXU  (S_IRUSR|S_IWUSR|S_IXUSR)
00102 #endif
00103 
00104 #ifndef   S_IREAD
00105 #  define S_IREAD  S_IRUSR
00106 #  define S_IWRITE S_IWUSR
00107 #  define S_IEXEC  S_IXUSR
00108 #endif
00109 
00110 #ifndef   S_IRGRP
00111 #  define  S_IRGRP  (S_IRUSR >> 3) /* Read by group.  */
00112 #  define  S_IWGRP  (S_IWUSR >> 3) /* Write by group.  */
00113 #  define  S_IXGRP  (S_IXUSR >> 3) /* Execute by group. */
00114 /* Read, write, and execute by group.  */
00115 #  define  S_IRWXG  (S_IRWXU >> 3)
00116 
00117 #  define  S_IROTH  (S_IRGRP >> 3) /* Read by others.  */
00118 #  define  S_IWOTH  (S_IWGRP >> 3) /* Write by others.  */
00119 #  define  S_IXOTH  (S_IXGRP >> 3) /* Execute by others. */
00120 /* Read, write, and execute by others. */
00121 #  define  S_IRWXO  (S_IRWXG >> 3)
00122 #endif
00123 
00124 #ifndef HAVE_LOCALTIME_R
00125 #define localtime_r( _clock,_result) (*(_result) = *localtime((_clock)),(_result))
00126 #endif
00127 
00128 #define mkdir(path,mode)                mkdir(path)
00129 /* win32 doesn't have symbolic link, so just #define it to stat */
00130 #define lstat(x,y)            stat(x, y)
00131 /* win32 doesn't have strcasecmp, they have stricmp, so just #define it to strcasecmp
00132 #define strcasecmp(s1,s2)     stricmp(s1,s2)
00133 #define strncasecmp(s1,s2,n)  strnicmp(s1,s2,n)
00134 */
00135 /* win32 doesn't have the same kind of sleep as UNIX, so make a version that behaves the same */
00136 #define sleep(seconds)        (Sleep(seconds * 1000))
00137 /* Make all changes done to FD actually appear on disk */
00138 #define fsync(fd)             _commit(fd)
00139 /* Truncate the file FD refers to to LENGTH bytes */
00140 #define ftruncate                                       _chsize
00141 /* Determines whether a file descriptor is associated with a character device */
00142 #define isatty(fd)             _isatty(fd)
00143 
00144 /*
00145 extern __declspec(dllexport) int        fsync(int fd);
00146 */

00148 /**************** environment variables *****************/
00149 
00150 #define setenv(__pname,__pvalue,___overwrite) ({ int result; \
00151  if (___overwrite == 0 && getenv (__pname)) result = 0; \
00152  else                                       result = SetEnvironmentVariable (__pname,__pvalue); \
00153  result; })
00154 
00155 #define unsetenv(pname) SetEnvironmentVariable(pname, NULL)
00156 
00157 /* These depend upon the type of sigset_t, which right now is always a long..
00158    They're in the POSIX namespace, but are not ANSI.
00159 */
00160 #define sigemptyset(what)   (*(what) = 0)
00161 #define sigaddset(what,sig) (*(what) |= (1<<(sig)))

00163 #define SIGHUP     1
00164 #define SIGQUIT    3 /* Quit (POSIX) */
00165 #define SIGKILL    9 /* Kill, unblockable (POSIX) */
00166 #define SIGBUS    10 /* ,7,10 */
00167 #define SIGPIPE   13
00168 #define SIGALRM   14
00169 #define SIGUSR1   16 /* ,30,10 */
00170 #define SIGUSR2   17 /* ,31,12 */
00171 #define SIGCHLD   20 /* ,17,18 */
00172 
00173 #define SIG_SETMASK   0    /* set mask with sigprocmask() */
00174 #define SIG_BLOCK     1    /* set of signals to block */
00175 #define SIG_UNBLOCK   2    /* set of signals to, well, unblock */
00176 #define SHUT_RD       0
00177 #define SHUT_WR       1
00178 #define WNOHANG       1    /* Don't block waiting */
00179 #define WUNTRACED     2    /* Report status of stopped children */
00180 #define ITIMER_REAL   1
00181 #define ITIMER_PROF   2
00182 #define RLIMIT_DATA   2    /* max data size */
00183 #define RLIMIT_STACK  3    /* max stack size */
00184 #define MS_SYNC       4
00185 #define PROT_NONE     0x0  /* page can not be accessed */
00186 #define PROT_READ     0x1  /* page can be read */
00187 #define PROT_WRITE    0x2  /* Page can be written */
00188 #define PROT_EXEC     0x4  /* page can be executed */
00189 #define MAP_FIXED     0x10 /* Interpret addr exactly */
00190 #define MAP_PRIVATE   0x02 /* Changes are private */
00191 #define MAP_SHARED    0x01 /* Share changes */
00192 #define MAP_ANONYMOUS 0x20 /* Don't use a file. */
00193 #define MAP_ANON      MAP_ANONYMOUS
00194 #define MAP_FAILED    ((void*)-1)

00196 #define ENOTSUP          48 /* This is the value in Solaris */
00197 #define EBADRQC       54 /* "Invalid request code" */
00198 #define ENODATA       61 /* "No data (for no delay io)" */
00199 #define ENONET        64 /* "Machine is not on the network" */
00200 #define ENOLINK       67 /* "The link has been severed" */
00201 #define ECOMM         70 /* "Communication error on send" */
00202 #define ENOTUNIQ      80 /* "Given log. name not unique" */
00203 #define ENMFILE       89 /* "No more files" */
00204 #define EMSGSIZE      90 /* Message too long */
00205 #define ENOMEDIUM    135 /* "no medium" */
00206 #define ENOSHARE     136 /* "No such host or network path" */
00207 #define EOVERFLOW    139 /* "Value too large for defined data type" */
00208 #define ETIMEDOUT    110 /* Connection timed out */
00209 #define EINPROGRESS  115 /* Operation now in progress */

00248 /* POSIX.1b structure for a time value. This is like a `struct timeval' but has nanoseconds instead of microseconds. */
00249 
00250 struct timespec {
00251    time_t   tv_sec;  /* Seconds. */
00252    long int tv_nsec; /* Nanoseconds. */
00253 };

00321 /* Perform a mapping of Win32 error numbers into POSIX errno's */
00322 
00323 #ifndef ELOOP
00324 #define ELOOP            40 /* Too many symbolic links encountered */
00325 #endif
00326 #ifndef ENOSR
00327 #define ENOSR            63 /* Out of streams resources */
00328 #endif
00329 #ifndef EUSERS
00330 #define EUSERS           87 /* Too many users */
00331 #endif
00332 #ifndef ENOTSOCK
00333 #define ENOTSOCK         88 /* Socket operation on non-socket */
00334 #endif
00335 #ifndef EDESTADDRREQ
00336 #define EDESTADDRREQ     89 /* Destination address required */
00337 #endif
00338 #ifndef EPROTOTYPE
00339 #define EPROTOTYPE       91 /* Protocol wrong type for socket */
00340 #endif
00341 #ifndef ENOPROTOOPT
00342 #define ENOPROTOOPT      92 /* Protocol not available */
00343 #endif
00344 #ifndef EPROTONOSUPPORT
00345 #define EPROTONOSUPPORT  93 /* Protocol not supported */
00346 #endif
00347 #ifndef ESOCKTNOSUPPORT
00348 #define ESOCKTNOSUPPORT  94 /* Socket type not supported */
00349 #endif
00350 #ifndef EOPNOTSUPP
00351 #define EOPNOTSUPP       95 /* Operation not supported on transport endpoint */
00352 #endif
00353 #ifndef EPFNOSUPPORT
00354 #define EPFNOSUPPORT     96 /* Protocol family not supported */
00355 #endif
00356 #ifndef EAFNOSUPPORT
00357 #define EAFNOSUPPORT     97 /* Address family not supported by protocol */
00358 #endif
00359 #ifndef EADDRINUSE
00360 #define EADDRINUSE       98 /* Address already in use */
00361 #endif
00362 #ifndef EADDRNOTAVAIL
00363 #define EADDRNOTAVAIL    99 /* Cannot assign requested address */
00364 #endif
00365 #ifndef ENETDOWN
00366 #define ENETDOWN        100 /* Network is down */
00367 #endif
00368 #ifndef ENETUNREACH
00369 #define ENETUNREACH     101 /* Network is unreachable */
00370 #endif
00371 #ifndef ENETRESET
00372 #define ENETRESET       102 /* Network dropped connection because of reset */
00373 #endif
00374 #ifndef ECONNABORTED
00375 #define ECONNABORTED    103 /* Software caused connection abort */
00376 #endif
00377 #ifndef ECONNRESET
00378 #define ECONNRESET      104 /* Connection reset by peer */
00379 #endif
00380 #ifndef ENOBUFS
00381 #define ENOBUFS         105 /* No buffer space available */
00382 #endif
00383 #ifndef EISCONN
00384 #define EISCONN         106 /* Transport endpoint is already connected */
00385 #endif
00386 #ifndef ENOTCONN
00387 #define ENOTCONN        107 /* Transport endpoint is not connected */
00388 #endif
00389 #ifndef ESHUTDOWN
00390 #define ESHUTDOWN       108 /* Cannot send after transport endpoint shutdown */
00391 #endif
00392 #ifndef ETOOMANYREFS
00393 #define ETOOMANYREFS    109 /* Too many references: cannot splice */
00394 #endif
00395 #ifndef ECONNREFUSED
00396 #define ECONNREFUSED    111 /* Connection refused */
00397 #endif
00398 #ifndef EHOSTDOWN
00399 #define EHOSTDOWN       112 /* Host is down */
00400 #endif
00401 #ifndef EHOSTUNREACH
00402 #define EHOSTUNREACH    113 /* No route to host */
00403 #endif
00404 #ifndef EALREADY
00405 #define EALREADY        114 /* Operation already in progress */
00406 #endif
00407 #ifndef ESTALE
00408 #define ESTALE          116 /* Stale NFS file handle */
00409 #endif
00410 #ifndef EREMOTE
00411 #define EREMOTE         121 /* Remote I/O error */
00412 #endif
00413 #ifndef EDQUOT
00414 #define EDQUOT          122 /* Quota exceeded */
00415 #endif

00417 #define MAP_WIN32_ERROR_TO_POSIX \
00418   switch (errno) {\
00419   case ERROR_BAD_PATHNAME:\
00420   case ERROR_INVALID_NAME:\
00421   case ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND:\
00422   case ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND:\
00423   errno = ENOENT; break;\
00424   case ERROR_OUTOFMEMORY:\
00425   case ERROR_BUFFER_OVERFLOW:\
00426   case ERROR_NOT_ENOUGH_MEMORY:\
00427   errno = ENOMEM; break;\
00428   case ERROR_ACCESS_DENIED:\
00429   case ERROR_LOCK_VIOLATION:\
00430   case ERROR_SHARING_VIOLATION:\
00431   errno = EACCES; break;\
00432   case ERROR_FILE_EXISTS:\
00433   case ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS:\
00434   errno = EEXIST; break;\
00435   case WSAEWOULDBLOCK:\
00436   case ERROR_MORE_DATA:\
00437   case ERROR_OPEN_FILES:\
00438   case ERROR_NO_PROC_SLOTS:\
00439   case ERROR_DEVICE_IN_USE:\
00440   case ERROR_MAX_THRDS_REACHED:\
00441   case ERROR_ACTIVE_CONNECTIONS:\
00442   errno = EAGAIN; break;\
00443   case WSAEINVAL:\
00444   case ERROR_NO_TOKEN:\
00445   case ERROR_BAD_PIPE:\
00446   case ERROR_BAD_USERNAME:\
00447   case ERROR_INVALID_DATA:\
00448   case ERROR_NEGATIVE_SEEK:\
00449   case ERROR_THREAD_1_INACTIVE:\
00450   case ERROR_INVALID_PARAMETER:\
00451   case ERROR_FILENAME_EXCED_RANGE:\
00452   case ERROR_INVALID_SIGNAL_NUMBER:\
00453   case ERROR_META_EXPANSION_TOO_LONG:\
00454   errno = EINVAL; break;\
00455   case ERROR_CRC:\
00456   case ERROR_IO_DEVICE:\
00457   case ERROR_OPEN_FAILED:\
00458   case ERROR_SIGNAL_REFUSED:\
00459   case ERROR_NO_SIGNAL_SENT:\
00460   errno = EIO; break;\
00461   case ERROR_NO_DATA:\
00462   case ERROR_BROKEN_PIPE:\
00463   errno = EPIPE; break;\
00464   case ERROR_BUSY:\
00465   case ERROR_PIPE_BUSY:\
00466   case ERROR_SIGNAL_PENDING:\
00467   case ERROR_PIPE_CONNECTED:\
00468   case ERROR_CHILD_NOT_COMPLETE:\
00469   errno = EBUSY; break;\
00470   case ERROR_BAD_UNIT:\
00471   case ERROR_BAD_DEVICE:\
00472   case ERROR_INVALID_DRIVE:\
00473   errno = ENODEV; break;\
00474   case ERROR_DISK_FULL:\
00475   case ERROR_EOM_OVERFLOW:\
00476   case ERROR_END_OF_MEDIA:\
00477   case ERROR_HANDLE_DISK_FULL:\
00478   case ERROR_NO_DATA_DETECTED:\
00479   errno = ENOSPC; break;\
00480   case ERROR_NOT_OWNER:\
00481   case ERROR_CANNOT_MAKE:\
00482   errno = EPERM; break;\
00483   case WSAEFAULT:\
00484   case ERROR_NOACCESS:\
00485   case ERROR_INVALID_ADDRESS:\
00486   case ERROR_PROCESS_ABORTED:\
00487   errno = EFAULT; break;\
00488   case ERROR_NOT_SUPPORTED:\
00489   case ERROR_CALL_NOT_IMPLEMENTED:\
00490   errno = ENOSYS; break;\
00491   case ERROR_PIPE_LISTENING:\
00492   case ERROR_PIPE_NOT_CONNECTED:\
00493   errno = ECOMM; break;\
00494   case ERROR_BAD_NETPATH:\
00495   case ERROR_BAD_NET_NAME:\
00496   errno = ENOSHARE; break;\
00497   case ERROR_SETMARK_DETECTED:\
00498   case ERROR_BEGINNING_OF_MEDIA:\
00499   errno = ESPIPE; break;\
00500   case ERROR_TOO_MANY_OPEN_FILES:\
00501   errno = EMFILE; break;\
00502   case ERROR_INVALID_HANDLE:\
00503   errno = EBADF; break;\
00504   case ERROR_NOT_SAME_DEVICE:\
00505   errno = EXDEV; break;\
00506   case ERROR_WRITE_PROTECT:\
00507   errno = EROFS; break;\
00508   case ERROR_SHARING_BUFFER_EXCEEDED:\
00509   errno = ENOLCK; break;\
00510   case ERROR_NO_MORE_SEARCH_HANDLES:\
00511   errno = ENFILE; break;\
00512   case ERROR_WAIT_NO_CHILDREN:\
00513   errno = ECHILD; break;\
00514   case WSAENOTEMPTY:\
00515   case ERROR_DIR_NOT_EMPTY:\
00516   errno = ENOTEMPTY; break;\
00517   case ERROR_DIRECTORY:\
00518   errno = ENOTDIR; break;\
00519   case WSAEINTR:\
00520   case ERROR_INVALID_AT_INTERRUPT_TIME:\
00521   errno = EINTR; break;\
00522   case ERROR_FILE_INVALID:\
00523   errno = ENXIO; break;\
00524   case ERROR_INVALID_FUNCTION:\
00525   errno = EBADRQC; break;\
00526   case ERROR_NO_MORE_FILES:\
00527   errno = ENMFILE; break;\
00528   case ERROR_HANDLE_EOF:\
00529   errno = ENODATA; break;\
00530   case ERROR_REM_NOT_LIST:\
00531   errno = ENONET; break;\
00532   case ERROR_DUP_NAME:\
00533   errno = ENOTUNIQ; break;\
00534   case ERROR_NOT_CONNECTED:\
00535   errno = ENOLINK; break;\
00536   case ERROR_POSSIBLE_DEADLOCK:\
00537   errno = EDEADLOCK; break;\
00538   case ERROR_NOT_READY:\
00539   errno = ENOMEDIUM; break;\
00540   case WSAEINPROGRESS:\
00541   errno = EINPROGRESS; break;\
00542   case WSAETIMEDOUT:\
